intro: Streptanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of white or yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Streptanthus angustifolius is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, coastal environments.
